description: System-generated unique identifier for this purchase order record.
Optional prefix used with the number to form the full purchase order ID; confirm format with SME.
Sequential number component of the purchase order identifier, typically combined with a prefix.
Release number identifying a specific release against a blanket purchase agreement; confirm usage.
Code indicating the kind of purchase order (e.g., standard, blanket, contract, service); mapping required.
Indicates the order is a blanket agreement or references its blanket header; confirm data type and linkage.
Start of the order’s effective period or planned start for fulfillment (especially for blanket/contract orders).
End of the order’s effective period or last valid date for releases.
Flag specifying whether pricing is captured as a single lump-sum amount rather than itemized; confirm behavior.
Indicator for a final release against a blanket order; exact meaning may vary by system. Confirm with SME.
Total lump-sum amount for the order when not itemized by lines.
Priority level or urgency code for purchasing and receiving.
Lifecycle status code of the order (e.g., draft, approved, transmitted, closed, cancelled); mapping required.
Receiving warehouse/location code for delivery of goods or services.
Indicator or counter of whether/how the order was sent to the vendor (e.g., EDI, email); confirm semantics.
Identifier of the purchasing agent or requester responsible for the order.
Vendor identifier to whom the purchase order is issued.
Project or job code to which costs from this order are allocated.
Primary general ledger account charged for this order’s costs.
Indicates costs are split across multiple GL accounts or references a split allocation; confirm implementation.
Date and time the order was placed with the vendor.
Timestamp when the order record was created in the system.
Timestamp when the order received required approval.
Expected delivery or fulfillment date for the order or first release.
Date the order was fully received and closed.
Date the order was cancelled.
Free-text reference or external document number associated with the order.
Identifier of the approver who authorized the order.
Primary contact person at the vendor for this order.
Telephone number for the vendor contact.
Fax number for the vendor contact.
Email address for the vendor contact.
Your organization’s account number as recorded by the vendor.
Currency code used for order amounts; mapping to currency master required. Confirm whether foreign or functional currency.
Exchange rate used to convert order currency to base currency at time of booking.
Name or code of the shipping carrier used for delivery.
GL account where shipping charges for this order are posted.
Payment terms agreed with the vendor (e.g., Net 30); mapping required.
Shipping terms (e.g., FOB, Incoterms) defining delivery responsibilities and risk transfer.
Freight terms indicating who pays freight and when.
Estimated shipping cost at the time of ordering.
Estimated freight cost at the time of ordering.
Actual shipping cost recorded upon receipt or invoicing.
Actual freight cost recorded upon receipt or invoicing.
Billing address line 1 for invoice remittance.
Billing address line 2.
Billing address line 3.
Billing city.
Billing state or province.
Billing postal or ZIP code.
Billing country.
Billing county or district, if applicable.
Contact person for billing/invoices.
Title or role of the billing contact.
Phone number for the billing contact.
Fax number for the billing contact.
Email address for the billing contact.
Flag allowing remaining parts budget from a linked agreement/blanket order to be used; confirm behavior.
Flag allowing remaining labor budget from a linked agreement/blanket order to be used; confirm behavior.
Flag allowing remaining miscellaneous budget from a linked agreement/blanket order to be used; confirm behavior.
Timestamp of the most recent update to this record.
Number of distinct line items on the order.
Serialized options or flags affecting order processing; definition varies by implementation. Confirm with SME.
Audit field recording when the last user-triggered change occurred; appears to store a timestamp. Confirm semantics.
Department or cost center responsible for this purchase.
Alternate or internal purchase order identifier; relationship to business number and primary key should be confirmed with SME.
User identifier of the person who created the record.
Date and time the record was created by that user.
User identifier of the person who last modified the record.
Date and time of the last modification by that user.
